paper.title: Constructive design of a hierarchy of semantics of a transition system by abstract interpretation
paper.abstract: We construct a hierarchy of semantics by successive abstract interpretations. Starting from the maximal trace semantics of a transition system, we derive the big-step semantics, termination and nontermination semantics, Plotkinu0027s natural, Smythu0027s demoniac and Hoareu0027s angelic relational semantics and equivalent nondeterministic denotational semantics (with alternative powerdomains to the Egli-Milner and Smyth constructions), D. Scottu0027s deterministic denotational semantics, the generalized and Dijkstrau0027s conservative/liberal predicate transformer semantics, the generalized/total and Hoareu0027s partial correctness axiomatic semantics and the corresponding proof methods. All the semantics are presented in a uniform fixpoint form and the correspondences between these semantics are established through composable Galois connections, each semantics being formally calculated by abstract interpretation of a more concrete one using Kleene and/or Tarski fixpoint approximation transfer theorems.
